raw_comment:
I noticed that being part of a legacy at the school is gonna help boost the chances of a person being admitted by a lot more than if they weren't.  I wonder why that little dip in the graph is there near 90th. This relates to me because I will be only the second person in my family to go to college, and I don't have that advantage that others have being a middle class and non legacy applicant which will hurt my chances of being admitted.
Title: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree
ace_sentences: A legacy applicant is an applicant.
A legacy applicant has a family member who attended the school.
I noticed that being a legacy applicant increases the chance of admission.
I noticed that this increase is larger than the increase for a non-legacy applicant.
I wonder why a small dip in the graph exists near the 90th percentile.
I will be the second person in my family who goes to college.
I do not have the legacy advantage.
This lack of advantage will hurt my chance of admission.
The title is: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree.
